node.title: At first, Matil heard 'gibberish' in class â€” before going on to become dux of her school
node.description: Matil Haddad went from hearing "gibberish" in class to getting the highest ATAR in her high school, and being part of the top 20 students in the NT.
node.content:
["Matil Haddad has gone from hearing \"gibberish\" in class to getting the highest ATAR in her high school\u00a0and being one of the top 20 students in the Northern Territory.", "She came to Alice Springs as a Syrian refugee four years ago, at the age of 14.", "At the time, she was the only person in her family who could speak English.", "", "
Matil Haddad was the only member of her family who could speak English when they moved from Syria to Australia.(Supplied:\u00a0Matil Haddad)
", "\"I was sort of thrown into this new world, and it was like 'OK, now go be an adult', and I was not ready;\u00a0it was hard,\" she said.", "Being one of the only Arab families in Alice Springs, there were no translators available to help her parents, so she was the family's translator.", "
'Everything sounded like gibberish'
", "While developing English, she had to organise putting herself and her younger brother, who lives with Down syndrome, in school.", "\"My brother is quite a strong dude;\u00a0it was hard for us, but I just can't imagine how hard it must have been for him and how strange,\" Ms Haddad said.", "", "
Matil Haddad is one of the top 20 students in the Northern Territory for 2021.\u00a0(Supplied:\u00a0Matil Haddad)
", "\"All of a sudden, you're in a school where people just don't speak the language that you do,\" she said.", "Ms Haddad\u00a0was the only Arabic speaker in her school and needed a translator to learn and communicate with friends.", "\"If they didn't arrive, I wouldn't have understood anything.\u00a0", "\"English was hard;\u00a0I failed English for my first semester in year 9,\" Ms Haddad said.", "She also had to teach herself how to use her laptop.", "\"I would open every single app that came on the school laptop just to know what each of them does,\" Ms Haddad said.", "
Dux of school and NT's top 20
", "But she surprised herself and her family\u00a0when finding out about her results, and she was dux of Our Lady of the Sacred Heart Catholic College.", "When Ms Haddad got a phone call on Friday, days before the official date of getting her ATAR results, she found out that she was in NT's top 20 students.", "\"I was on a phone call with the principal. And he told me that I was in NT's top 20, and I had to prepare to go to Darwin, and I started crying \u2014 like no shame, I burst into tears,\" she said.", "Her mother, Rabia Chreki, was the first to learn of her daughter's results through a phone call.", "", "
Matil Haddad says she was in tears when she told her mother, Rabia Chreki.(Supplied:\u00a0Matil Haddad)
", "\"When Matil FaceTimed me,\u00a0and she was crying, I was so anxious like something was wrong,\" Ms Chreki said.", "As a refugee,\u00a0she said it was a \"complex feeling\" to see her daughter's performance.", "\"It's not just about the success itself ...\u00a0she was able to get that success regardless of the conditions and all the things that we had adapted through. This makes me so proud,\" Ms Chreki said.", "Ms Chreki was an engineer before coming to Australia\u00a0and is happy to see her daughter find passion in science and maths too.", "\"She wouldn't have this kind of opportunity in Syria,\" she said.", "
'I want to make a difference'
", "Coming from Syria, Ms Haddad understands firsthand the importance of science and medicine.", "\"When you're coming from a country as I do, and when you always feel like death is so close, you realise how important doctors are and how important medicine is,\" she said.", "Ms Haddad\u00a0hopes to study medicine or science this year at university, but she's keeping her options open.", "", "
Matil Haddad says she wants to make a difference in the fields of medecine and science.(Supplied)
", "\"I remember for the longest time as a kid saying that I wanted to be a scientist, and I wanted to work for NASA,\" she said.", "\"I want to make a difference. I want to leave a mark;\u00a0I want someone to remember my name,\" Ms Haddad said."]
